lexUnit.name: coy.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: reluctant to give details about something sensitive.

sentence.text: Officials are coy about the details .
Conservative Central Office is coy about his involvement , still maintaining that Major writes his own speeches .
Official reports into local government administration have in the past been extremely coy about the significance of such Partisanship for the matters they investigated .
The Labour party has become ever so coy about the details of its renationalisation plans .
The hon. Member for Sedgefield has been uncharacteristically coy about the Labour party 's attitude to training credits .
And secondly , and very much wrapped up in the same point with this , they 're also coy about the sort of people they 're looking for .
The report is coy on major policy implications .
Gordon Smith , Caledonian 's sales director -- the company is increasing its sponsorship though it remains coy on an amount -- said it viewed the association with Currie as long term .
` One hint , do n't be so coy with the men you deal with , they might misconstrue your intentions and try to take advantage of you . "
The company is coy about revealing the profits from its US OTC products .
But countries like Russia and China are rather coy about releasing such details .
Perrier 's coy advertising , aimed at yuppies everywhere , made bottled water fashionable .
This coy introduction refers to a problem consisting of a ` vegetable " child who is kept locked away in a cupboard , and who they eventually kill .
` I 'm not being coy , " she protested .

Parallan marketing director David Fields was equally coy : he told the German weekly that ` a co-operation with IBM would in every regard be advantageous , since our products are quite compatible with IBM 's line " .
Alison was a little coy about how much her Russian dress cost , but , according to the staff at David Fielden , their cheapest frock is at least 1,000 .
Dr David Reid has met Mrs W many times , although he is somewhat coy when asked if he has examined the W children .
